entries.content: Read and understood the Writing Gym context - a coaching tool that builds writers' skills through structured reflection rather than AI rewrites. Ready to build the prototype: pre-draft questions → draft → self-assessment → AI assessment → comparison loop.

Scaffolded project structure: React+Vite+Tailwind client on port 3000, Express server on port 3001 with API proxy. App.jsx has step state machine (context→draft→self_assess→ai_assess→compare). Server has placeholder endpoints for /api/extract-criteria and /api/assess-draft.

Built PreDraftQuestions component with 4 coaching questions (audience, intent, concerns, type). Wired into App.jsx with validation, loading state, error handling, and API call to /api/extract-criteria. Shows extracted criteria on draft step.

entries.message: Initial scaffold: React+Vite+Tailwind client, Express server with PreDraftQuestions component

entries.content: Implemented /api/extract-criteria with Anthropic API. Prompt extracts 3-5 criteria from user's context answers, phrased as ratable statements. Uses claude-sonnet-4-20250514, returns JSON with id, description, extracted_from, and scale.

Built DraftInput (text area with criteria reminder, char count) and SelfAssessment (1-5 scale buttons for each criterion with labels). Wired into App.jsx flow: context → draft → self_assess → compare. Comparison view shows raw JSON for now.

Implemented /api/assess-draft with Anthropic API. Scores each criterion 1-5 with reasoning. Prompt includes full context (audience, intent, concerns, type), criteria list, and draft. Returns scores and reasoning objects keyed by criterion ID.

Completed prototype learning loop! ComparisonView shows self vs AI scores side-by-side with delta indicators (overestimate/underestimate), AI reasoning, average scores, and Revise Draft button for iteration.

entries.message: Complete prototype learning loop: draft input, self-assessment, AI assessment, and comparison view

entries.content: Working prototype of The Writing Gym\! Full coaching loop: pre-draft questions → criteria extraction → draft writing → self-assessment → AI assessment → comparison with blind spot detection. Coach, don't rewrite.

entries.content: Implemented inline criterion pushback / context notes. Users can now respond to specific AI feedback with their own context (e.g. 'my team has Confluence docs — a pointer IS the clear next step'). Notes are session-level, stored in criterionNotes map keyed by criterion ID. They persist across iterations and get injected into the AI assessment prompt as [Writer's context: "..."] annotations so the AI factors them into scoring. Touched 7 files: useSession hook (state + saveCriterionNote action + API payload), prop threading through App → Workspace → HistoryPanel → IterationCard, new CriterionNote component in AssessmentComparison with Add context / Edit / Save+Cancel UI (slate-colored, visually distinct from AI reasoning), and assess-draft API endpoint to weave notes into the criteria list sent to Claude.

Skip self-assessment on iterations 2+. Iteration 1 keeps the full self-assess → AI-assess → comparison calibration flow. Iterations 2+ submit draft and immediately fire AI assessment with previous iteration's scores as context — no self-assessment form. AI prompt now includes prior assessment so reasoning references specific improvements/regressions. AssessmentComparison has two rendering modes: CalibrationView (iteration 1, self vs AI with DeltaIndicator) and ProgressView (iterations 2+, AI scores with ProgressIndicator showing green/red/gray deltas from previous iteration). Changed 5 files: useSession.js (extracted fetchAiAssessment helper, async submitDraft), assess-draft.js (previousAssessment in prompt), IterationCard.jsx (conditional self-assess gating), HistoryPanel.jsx (previousAiScores computation), AssessmentComparison.jsx (CalibrationView + ProgressView split).
